variables.description:
Default variables for the Cloud Run worker.

The schema for this class is used to populate the `variables` section of the default
base job template.

name.description: Name given to infrastructure created by a worker.
name.title: Name

env.description: Environment variables to set when starting a flow run.
env.title: Environment Variables

labels.description: Labels applied to infrastructure created by a worker.
labels.title: Labels

command.description: The command to use when starting a flow run. In most cases, this should be left blank and the command will be automatically generated by the worker.
command.title: Command

region.description: The region where the Cloud Run Job resides.
region.title: Region

credentials.description: The GCP Credentials used to initiate the Cloud Run Job. If not provided credentials will be inferred from the local environment.
credentials.title: GCP Credentials

prefect_api_key_secret.description: A GCP secret containing a Prefect API Key. This key will be used to authenticate Cloud Run tasks with Prefect Cloud. If not provided, the PREFECT_API_KEY environment variable will be used if the worker has one.
prefect_api_key_secret.title: Prefect API Key Secret

prefect_api_auth_string_secret.description: A GCP secret containing a Prefect API authorization string. This string will be used to authenticate Cloud Run tasks with Prefect Cloud. If not provided, the PREFECT_API_AUTH_STRING environment variable will be used if the worker has one.
prefect_api_auth_string_secret.title: Prefect API Auth String Secret

image.description: The image to use for a new Cloud Run Job. If not set, the latest Prefect image will be used. See https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/deploying#images.
image.title: Image Name

cpu.description: The amount of compute allocated to the Cloud Run Job. (1000m = 1 CPU). See https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/cpu#setting-jobs.
cpu.title: CPU

memory.description: The amount of memory allocated to the Cloud Run Job. Must be specified in units of 'G', 'Gi', 'M', or 'Mi'. See https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/memory-limits#setting.
memory.title: Memory

vpc_connector_name.description: The name of the VPC connector to use for the Cloud Run Job.
vpc_connector_name.title: VPC Connector Name

service_account_name.description: The name of the service account to use for the task execution of Cloud Run Job. By default Cloud Run jobs run as the default Compute Engine Service Account.
service_account_name.title: Service Account Name

keep_job.description: Keep the completed Cloud Run Job after it has run.
keep_job.title: Keep Job After Completion

timeout.description: Max allowed duration the Job may be active before Cloud Run will actively try to mark it failed and kill associated containers (maximum of 3600 seconds, 1 hour).
timeout.title: Job Timeout

GcpCredentials.description:
Block used to manage authentication with GCP. Google authentication is
handled via the `google.oauth2` module or through the CLI.
Specify either one of service `account_file` or `service_account_info`; if both
are not specified, the client will try to detect the credentials following Google's
[Application Default Credentials](https://cloud.google.com/docs/authentication/application-default-credentials).
See Google's [Authentication documentation](https://cloud.google.com/docs/authentication#service-accounts)
for details on inference and recommended authentication patterns.

service_account_file.description: Path to the service account JSON keyfile.
service_account_file.title: Service Account File

service_account_info.description: The contents of the keyfile as a dict.
service_account_info.title: Service Account Info

project.description: The GCP project to use for the client.
project.title: Project

GcpCredentials.title: GcpCredentials

SecretKeySelector.description:
SecretKeySelector is a data model for specifying a GCP secret to inject
into a Cloud Run V2 Job as an environment variable.
Follows Cloud Run V2 rest API, docs:
https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/reference/rest/v2/Container#SecretKeySelector
SecretKeySelector.title: SecretKeySelector

cloud-run.description: Execute flow runs within containers on Google Cloud Run. Requires a Google Cloud Platform account.

variables.description:
Default variables for the v2 Cloud Run worker.

The schema for this class is used to populate the `variables` section of the
default base job template.

name.description: Name given to infrastructure created by a worker.
name.title: Name

env.description: Environment variables to set when starting a flow run.
env.title: Environment Variables

labels.description: Labels applied to infrastructure created by a worker.
labels.title: Labels

command.description: The command to use when starting a flow run. In most cases, this should be left blank and the command will be automatically generated by the worker.
command.title: Command

credentials.description: The GCP Credentials used to connect to Cloud Run. If not provided credentials will be inferred from the local environment.
credentials.title: GCP Credentials

region.description: The region in which to run the Cloud Run job
region.title: Region

image.description: The image to use for the Cloud Run job. If not provided the default Prefect image will be used.
image.title: Image Name

args.description: The arguments to pass to the Cloud Run Job V2's entrypoint command.
args.title: Args

env_from_secrets.description: Environment variables to set from GCP secrets when starting a flow run.
env_from_secrets.title: Environment Variables from Secrets

prefect_api_key_secret.description: The GCP secret to use for the Prefect API key. When provided, the secret will be used instead of the PREFECT_API_KEY environment variable.
prefect_api_key_secret.title: Prefect API Key Secret

prefect_api_auth_string_secret.description: The GCP secret to use for the Prefect API auth string. When provided, the secret will be used instead of the PREFECT_API_AUTH_STRING environment variable.
prefect_api_auth_string_secret.title: Prefect API Auth String Secret

cloudsql_instances.description: List of Cloud SQL instance connection names to connect to. Format: {project}:{location}:{instance}
cloudsql_instances.title: Cloud SQL Instances

keep_job.description: Keep the completed Cloud run job on Google Cloud Platform.
keep_job.title: Keep Job After Completion

launch_stage.description: The launch stage of the Cloud Run Job V2. See https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/about-features-categories for additional details.
launch_stage.title: Launch Stage

max_retries.description: The number of times to retry the Cloud Run job.
max_retries.title: Max Retries

cpu.description: The CPU to allocate to the Cloud Run job.
cpu.title: CPU

memory.description: The memory to allocate to the Cloud Run job along with the units, whichcould be: G, Gi, M, Mi.
memory.title: Memory

timeout.description: Max allowed time duration the Job may be active before Cloud Run will  actively try to mark it failed and kill associated containers (maximum of 86400 seconds, 1 day).
timeout.title: Job Timeout

vpc_connector_name.description: The name of the VPC connector to use for the Cloud Run job.
vpc_connector_name.title: VPC Connector Name

service_account_name.description: The name of the service account to use for the task execution of Cloud Run Job. By default Cloud Run jobs run as the default Compute Engine Service Account.
service_account_name.title: Service Account Name

GcpCredentials.description:
Block used to manage authentication with GCP. Google authentication is
handled via the `google.oauth2` module or through the CLI.
Specify either one of service `account_file` or `service_account_info`; if both
are not specified, the client will try to detect the credentials following Google's
[Application Default Credentials](https://cloud.google.com/docs/authentication/application-default-credentials).
See Google's [Authentication documentation](https://cloud.google.com/docs/authentication#service-accounts)
for details on inference and recommended authentication patterns.

service_account_file.description: Path to the service account JSON keyfile.
service_account_file.title: Service Account File

service_account_info.description: The contents of the keyfile as a dict.
service_account_info.title: Service Account Info

project.description: The GCP project to use for the client.
project.title: Project

GcpCredentials.title: GcpCredentials

SecretKeySelector.description:
SecretKeySelector is a data model for specifying a GCP secret to inject
into a Cloud Run V2 Job as an environment variable.
Follows Cloud Run V2 rest API, docs:
https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/reference/rest/v2/Container#SecretKeySelector
SecretKeySelector.title: SecretKeySelector

cloud-run-v2.description: Execute flow runs within containers on Google Cloud Run (V2 API). Requires a Google Cloud Platform account.

variables.description:
Default variables for the Vertex AI worker.

The schema for this class is used to populate the `variables` section of the default
base job template.

name.description: Name given to infrastructure created by a worker.
name.title: Name

env.description: Environment variables to set when starting a flow run.
env.title: Environment Variables

labels.description: Labels applied to infrastructure created by a worker.
labels.title: Labels

command.description: The command to use when starting a flow run. In most cases, this should be left blank and the command will be automatically generated by the worker.
command.title: Command

region.description: The region where the Vertex AI Job resides.
region.title: Region

image.description: The URI of a container image in the Container or Artifact Registry, used to run your Vertex AI Job. Note that Vertex AI will need accessto the project and region where the container image is stored. See https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/training/create-custom-container
image.title: Image Name

credentials.description: The GCP Credentials used to initiate the Vertex AI Job. If not provided credentials will be inferred from the local environment.
credentials.title: GCP Credentials

machine_type.description: The machine type to use for the run, which controls the available CPU and memory. See https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/reference/rest/v1/MachineSpec
machine_type.title: Machine Type

accelerator_type.description: The type of accelerator to attach to the machine. See https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/reference/rest/v1/MachineSpec
accelerator_type.title: Accelerator Type

accelerator_count.description: The number of accelerators to attach to the machine. See https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/reference/rest/v1/MachineSpec
accelerator_count.title: Accelerator Count

boot_disk_type.description: The type of boot disk to attach to the machine.
boot_disk_type.title: Boot Disk Type

boot_disk_size_gb.description: The size of the boot disk to attach to the machine, in gigabytes.
boot_disk_size_gb.title: Boot Disk Size (GB)

maximum_run_time_hours.description: The maximum job running time, in hours
maximum_run_time_hours.title: Maximum Run Time (Hours)

network.description: The full name of the Compute Engine networkto which the Job should be peered. Private services access must already be configured for the network. If left unspecified, the job is not peered with any network. For example: projects/12345/global/networks/myVPC
network.title: Network

reserved_ip_ranges.description: A list of names for the reserved ip ranges under the VPC network that can be used for this job. If set, we will deploy the job within the provided ip ranges. Otherwise, the job will be deployed to any ip ranges under the provided VPC network.
reserved_ip_ranges.title: Reserved IP Ranges

scheduling.description: A dictionary with scheduling options for a CustomJob, these are parameters related to queuing, and scheduling custom jobs. If unspecified default scheduling options are used. The 'maximum_run_time_hours' variable sets the job timeout field 'scheduling.timeout' for backward compatibility. See SDK: https://cloud.google.com/python/docs/reference/aiplatform/latest/google.cloud.aiplatform_v1.types.Scheduling See REST: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/reference/rest/v1/CustomJobSpec#Scheduling
scheduling.title: Scheduling Options

service_account_name.description: Specifies the service account to use as the run-as account in Vertex AI. The worker submitting jobs must have act-as permission on this run-as account. If unspecified, the AI Platform Custom Code Service Agent for the CustomJob's project is used. Takes precedence over the service account found in GCP credentials, and required if a service account cannot be detected in GCP credentials.
service_account_name.title: Service Account Name

enable_web_access.description: Whether you want Vertex AI to enable `interactive shell access` See https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/training/monitor-debug-interactive-shell for how to access your job via interactive console when running.
enable_web_access.title: Enable Web Access

enable_dashboard_access.description: Whether to enable access to the customized dashboard in the training chief container. See https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/training/monitor-debug-interactive-shell#get-uri for access instructions.
enable_dashboard_access.title: Enable Dashboard Access

job_watch_poll_interval.description: The amount of time to wait between GCP API calls while monitoring the state of a Vertex AI Job.
job_watch_poll_interval.title: Poll Interval (Seconds)

GcpCredentials.description:
Block used to manage authentication with GCP. Google authentication is
handled via the `google.oauth2` module or through the CLI.
Specify either one of service `account_file` or `service_account_info`; if both
are not specified, the client will try to detect the credentials following Google's
[Application Default Credentials](https://cloud.google.com/docs/authentication/application-default-credentials).
See Google's [Authentication documentation](https://cloud.google.com/docs/authentication#service-accounts)
for details on inference and recommended authentication patterns.

service_account_file.description: Path to the service account JSON keyfile.
service_account_file.title: Service Account File

service_account_info.description: The contents of the keyfile as a dict.
service_account_info.title: Service Account Info

project.description: The GCP project to use for the client.
project.title: Project

GcpCredentials.title: GcpCredentials

vertex-ai.description: Execute flow runs within containers on Google Vertex AI. Requires a Google Cloud Platform account.
